docs.snippet: Accompanied by his wife, greeted by honour guards, and entertained at banquets, Kim Jong Un made his international debut as North Korea's leader by being wined and dined in the capital of the world's most populous country.

headline.print_headline: North Korea's Kim Seen Building Global Status in Trip to China
headline.main: North Korea's Kim Seen Building Global Status in Trip to China

docs.snippet: Faced with tough questions last week from six journalists on live television, Mexican presidential front-runner Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador leaned back in his chair with a twinkle in his eye, laughing off criticism, at times making fun of himself.

headline.print_headline: Eye on the Presidency, Mexico Leftist Mixes Hardball and Softball
headline.main: Eye on the Presidency, Mexico Leftist Mixes Hardball and Softball

docs.snippet: U.S. Defense Secretary Jim Mattis said on Tuesday he had no reservations or concerns about President Donald Trump's incoming national security adviser, John Bolton, a hawk who has advocated using military force against North Korea and Iran.

headline.print_headline: Worried About Bolton? Pentagon Chief Mattis Dismisses Concerns
headline.main: Worried About Bolton? Pentagon Chief Mattis Dismisses Concerns

docs.snippet: Just three weeks after the Parkland school shooting, Gov. Rick Scott has signed into law Florida’s most aggressive gun reform in recent years.

headline.main: After School Shooting, Florida Changes Gun Law

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump's pledge to make the United States "energy dominant" is extending to Arctic Ocean waters despite a pending lawsuit and lack of approval for a required five-year drilling plan.

headline.main: Beaufort Sea Lease Sale Solicitation Draws Objections

docs.snippet: The recruiter, Musa Abu Dawud, provided logistics, money and weapons to let the group threaten and attack U.S. and Western interests, the military said.

headline.main: American Drone Strike in Libya Kills Top Qaeda Recruiter

docs.snippet: Our insistence on ascribing characteristics to entire generations is silly and can actually be harmful.

docs.snippet: After nine years of rising stocks, the market has been struggling. The Trump administration’s big shift on global trade hasn’t helped, our columnist says.
